bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: struck by fragment of shell in lumbar region

revisionDesc.change: additional proofing of transcription and encoding, identified keyword terms
checked OCR; added minimal mark-up for personal names, place names, and dates

body.p: CASE 111.—Lieutenant H. T. Barrows, Co. C, 7th Maryland, was struck, May 5, 1864, by a fragment of shell, in the left lumbar region. He was treated by Surgeon C. S. Nordquist, 83d New York Volunteers, at the 2d division hospital of the Fifth Corps. Severe pain and difficult micturition, with hæmaturia, led to the belief that a laceration of the kidney had been induced. On May 12th, this officer was sent to Washington and was treated in quarters by Surgeon Antisell, U. S. V. He recovered and on June 8, 1864, was placed on Court-Martial duty.
